title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 May 2013 - XWiki
content:
<Dale\_> has quit  
00:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:06 <vmassol> has quit  
03:20 <sburjan> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:41 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
06:53 <Denis> has quit  
07:14 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <evalica> has quit  
07:37 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
07:55 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <sburjan\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <sburjan\_\_> has quit  
10:11 <bouquetf> Hi guys. I played a bit with wiki manager and granting all privileges on xwiki user (db) seems strange as it allows this user to access all databases of the server (case of mysql at least). Any good practice on the subject ? (maybe something instead of grant all privileges on \*.\* ?)  
10:12 <vmassol> bouquetf: hi  
10:12 <vmassol> you just need to give enough privileges for the xwiki user to be able to create a schema  
10:13 <bouquetf> delete may be needed too for deleting a subwiki ?  
10:13 <bouquetf> or by default a user who create a database can delete it ?  
10:14 <bouquetf> I'll check in mysql documentation but thanks for the info  
10:14 <vmassol> yes deleting a schema is needed too if you wish to delete a subwiki  
10:19 <tmortagne> bouquetf: note that wikimanager also support reusing a database you would create by hand (not not give XWiki too much rights)  
10:19 <tmortagne> s/not not/to not/  
10:20 <bouquetf> I did not see this option, I'll check again thx  
10:21 <tmortagne> bouquetf: it's not an option, when you indicate the name of the wiki wikimanager tell you that database already exist and you can force using it  
10:30 <huhongbo> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: can I create a new wiki on myxwiki.org  
10:32 <vmassol> (before you bring it down)  
10:33 <vmassol> doing it  
10:33 <bouquetf> thx tmortagne, it worked as expected  
10:35 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <bouquetf> An other question, I've not found a french documentation, I missed it ? Or is there a project I can contribute to ? (I like translating documentations when I learn a new product :))  
10:42 <vmassol> bouquetf: no there's no French documentation  
10:42 <vmassol> because there are not enough translators to maintain a translation  
10:42 <vmassol> we can barely maintain the English version already :)  
10:45 <bouquetf> I think a french translation of the user documentation may add some business value, maybe as a community project ?  
10:47 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's not a good idea to create a new wiki on myxwiki.org  
10:47 <tmortagne> the template wiki hasn't been upgraded  
10:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: it's for sorin testing  
10:47 <vmassol> I'm copying another wiki  
10:47 <sburjan> tdelafosse: where did you came up with Ana Blandiana name ? :)  
10:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw I tried to copy the incubator wiki and it failed on some attachment copying  
10:48 <vmassol> now trying with another wiki  
10:48 <vmassol> some NPE which we need to investigate  
10:48 <tdelafosse> sburjan : It was Sergiu that wrote that :) Does it have a special meaning ? :)  
10:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: fyi https://gist.github.com/vmassol/5531207  
10:49 <sburjan> tdelafosse, it's a romanian writer :)  
10:49 <vmassol> bouquetf: I'm personally not fond of translations because I think they do a disservice to the project  
10:49 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks like empty attachment content or somehting  
10:49 <tmortagne> or broken attachment  
10:49 <vmassol> bouquetf: unless you have a large enough translation community  
10:50 <vmassol> the problem is that people will arrive on the translation and they will be incomplete and not up to date all the time, giving a bad quality to the project  
10:50 <vmassol> it could be done but it needs to be well done and clear what should be the expectations for someone who arrive there with some big banners, etc :)  
10:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: generally the solution for that is different community websites  
10:53 <tmortagne> instead of various translations on the same website  
10:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes, if the sites are different and handled externally it's probably better but you still need to be sure people don't mistake it for the main doc site  
10:54 <tmortagne> if it's clean on the community website home page and the adress is not the same (like xwiki.fr) that should not be mistaken  
10:54 <tmortagne> s/clean/clear/  
10:54 <vmassol> the community web site will need to have a visible banner to point to the main doc site  
10:55 <vmassol> but yes I agree that's a solution  
10:55 <vmassol> so bouquetf if you want to start a French web site for xwiki, you have everyone's blessings :)  
11:04 <bouquetf> vmassol: I agree with you for the translations, as we work with xwiki, it may be possible to integrate a clear workflow for translations with change management and so on. May be a nice project for a rampup on xwiki ;)  
11:05 <vmassol> :)  
11:11 <tmortagne> [WARN] starting the 5.0.1 in 10 minutes  
11:11 <tmortagne> \*release  
11:42 <tmortagne> 5.0.1 release started  
11:51 <sburjan> tmortagne, what was the previous version of myxwiki.org prior to 5.0 final ?  
11:52 <sburjan> (I am performing an upgrade and DW asks me the previous version)  
11:53 <tmortagne> sburjan: it's not asking you for previous version of myxwiki.org  
11:53 <tmortagne> it's asking you for previous version of the UI you had on your wiki  
11:53 <sburjan> yes  
11:53 <tmortagne> previous myxwiki.org version won't help you  
11:54 <sburjan> I am being asked by the DW, and don't know which to select  
11:55 <tmortagne> you can select "I don't know", you will get lots of conflicts that's all  
11:55 <sburjan> bbl, lunch  
11:55 <tmortagne> there is no way for DW to guess what previous version you had so there is no much we can do here  
11:56 <tmortagne> but please guys don't upgrade your wikis, we will upgrade myxwiki.org again when 5.0.1 is released  
11:59 <npm> has quit  
11:59 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
13:07 <sburjan> vmassol: should I wait until 5.0.1 is released to test on my wiki from myxwiki ?  
13:08 <vmassol> sburjan: depends when tmortagne can update myxwiki.org to 5.0.1  
13:15 <huhongbo> has quit  
13:15 <sburjan> tmortagne,: any ETA ?  
13:44 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <Denis> has quit  
13:57 <tmortagne> sburjan: the release is not done yet but the upgrade will be done today  
13:58 <tmortagne> so yes I think you can wait  
13:58 <sburjan> ok, I will wait  
14:24 <cjd> has quit  
14:28 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:30 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <tmortagne> [WARN] upgrading myxwiki.org  
14:39 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <vmassol> too bad my change wasn't in 5.0.1...  
14:43 <vmassol> I'd have loved to test it on incubator  
14:44 <vmassol> actually I can  
14:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: could we put a 5.0.2-SNAPSHOT jar on myxwiki.org?  
14:44 <vmassol> (it has only 1 change compared to 5.0.1 ATM)  
14:45 <tmortagne> vmassol: let me finish the upgrade fist then you can put whatever jer you want  
14:45 <vmassol> ok  
14:45 <tmortagne> s/jer/jar/  
14:45 <vmassol> is it going to be a problem for the EM?  
14:45 <tmortagne> what is ?  
14:46 <vmassol> (that one of its core dep is 5.0-SNAPSHOT)  
14:46 <vmassol> (when all others are 5.0.1)  
14:46 <tmortagne> one of it's jar will be 5.0.2-SNAPSHOT, does not mean anything special for EM  
14:47 <tmortagne> it only look at core extension when looking at dependencies  
14:47 <vmassol> when someone does an update it's not going to prevent it of unstatisfied dep?  
14:47 <vmassol> s/of/because of  
14:47 <tmortagne> it depends of your dependency  
14:47 <vmassol> other deps have a dep on oldcore 5.0.1  
14:47 <tmortagne> if your dependency say 5.0.1 or more then it won't be an issue  
14:47 <vmassol> and it's not going to be there  
14:47 <vmassol> it's  not my dep  
14:47 <vmassol> but the xwiki ones  
14:48 <vmassol> so 5.0-SNAPSHOT is an issue then, right?  
14:48 <vmassol> it has to be renamed into 5.0.2-SNAPSHOT  
14:48 <vmassol> correct?  
14:48 <tmortagne> 1) EM does not care about the core extension dependencies  
14:48 <tmortagne> 2) <version>5.0.1</version> means 5.0.1 or more for EM  
14:48 <tmortagne> I don't see how you can have 5.0-SNAPSHOT if you just built it  
14:49 <vmassol> ok so there's no dep check for core deps  
14:49 <vmassol> good  
14:49 <tmortagne> the current 5.0 branch is suppsoed to be on 5.0.2-SNAPSHOT  
14:49 <vmassol> ok; had forgotten that, thought it was on 5.0-SNAPSHOT as before$  
14:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: the 5.0 branch says 5.0-SNAPSHOT  
14:56 <vmassol> (in its pom.xml)  
14:58 <tmortagne> there is a bug in Maven release plugin then because it indicated that it was using 5.0.2-SNAPSHOT  
15:00 <vmassol> tmortagne: the problem I think is that the release script executes the release plugin on a temporary branch that is discarded after  
15:01 <tmortagne> indeed  
15:01 <tmortagne> the branch should be merged instead of removed  
15:03 <tmortagne> btw I confirm than the upgrade of the template wiki work very well with only one node, not going to be easy to debug that  
15:04 <cjd> has quit  
15:04 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:05 <vmassol> tmortagne: does the template have hidden docs ?  
15:05 <vmassol> you have a merge conflict to attend to for AnnotationCode ;)  
15:05 <tmortagne> the template was already on 4.5.3 so I doubt it's a good example for the issue I fixed for 5.0.1  
15:06 <vmassol> ok  
15:06 <vmassol> ah just got : #displayExtensionDetails\_progress($extension)  
15:06 <vmassol> on template.myxwiki.org  
15:06 <vmassol> the famous error that goes away after a refresh  
15:06 <vmassol> ...  
15:07 <vmassol> hmm another conglict for http://template.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AppWithinMinutes/LiveTableTemplate  
15:07 <vmassol> do you know why?  
15:07 <vmassol> looks empty  
15:08 <vmassol> how come you're getting conflicts thomas?  
15:08 <vmassol> there were no page changes between 5.0 and 5.0.1  
15:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: the template was not in 5.0  
15:08 <vmassol> you didn't upgrade it yesterday?  
15:09 <tmortagne> no because it was not working in cluster mode yesterday  
15:09 <vmassol> ok  
15:10 <tmortagne> it's also possible some of the conflicts come from the same issue we used to have with "template" fields where it was in the XAR but not saved in the DB and I reviewed what I had in XAR XML page yesterday to add all the missing fields with the syntax and the hidden fields  
15:11 <tmortagne> but better that than the opposite for now  
15:12 <tmortagne> I didnot get any conflict on the home page so I doubt it's that but will still need to be reviewed to see if everything really end up in the DB  
15:12 <tmortagne> main wiki and template wiki are done, finishing to upgrade node2  
15:13 <evalica> has quit  
15:24 <tmortagne> "Caused by: com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPSenderFailedException: 550 5.1.0 Authentication required"  
15:24 <tmortagne> looks like myxwiki.org mail setup is not so well on node2  
15:27 <tmortagne> [WARN] myxwiki.org upgrade done, finishing 5.0.1 release paper work before announcing it  
15:27 <tmortagne> (before announcing myxwiki.org upgrade)  
15:31 <sburjan> tmortagne so now I can try to upgrade my wiki from myxwiki ?  
15:31 <tmortagne> sburjan: yes you can  
15:32 <tmortagne> but we still don't know why sometime the DW UI does not work well in cluster mode on myxwiki.org so you might have the issue  
15:40 <sburjan> vmassol, tmortagne : I selected "I don't know" which was the previous UI version, and I got quite a lot of conflicts, but this is normal, right ?  
15:40 <vmassol> sburjan: you decide as a user if you find it normal or not :)  
15:41 <tmortagne> sburjan: there is no way to merge anything if EM does not have a previous version  
15:41 <tmortagne> so yes you get a lot of conflicts  
15:50 <sburjan> seems that I am having some issues, maybe because of the cluster issue  
15:50 <sburjan> my page gets suddenly refreshed and I get "null platform.extension.distributionWizard.${currentStepId}StepTitle"  
15:51 <tmortagne> when ?  
15:51 <sburjan> refreshing the page wil lget me back to the first step of DW :(  
15:52 <tmortagne> sounds like you switched from one node to the other  
15:52 <sburjan> while installing the new pages, I click Continue, Continue, and suddenly this happens  
15:52 <tmortagne> and the DW did not started in the second node  
15:52 <sburjan> ok, I'll leave it for tomorrow until we fix the modes issue  
15:52 <tmortagne> it's not going to be fixed tomorow...  
15:53 <sburjan> in this case the DW for myxwiki.org is notreliable at all  
15:53 <sburjan> after refreshing the page, I am now resumed to where the instalation left  
15:54 <sburjan> so switched back to node 1 it seems  
15:54 <sburjan> this is going to be a pain for users  
15:54 <sburjan> and again to node 2 with the first step of DW.  
15:55 <sburjan> I am doing this for 20+ minues and still I'm not able to migrate it  
15:59 <tmortagne> stoping node2  
16:01 <sburjan> tmortagne, now it seems I only get the first step of DW, even if refreshing  
16:01 <sburjan> :(  
16:01 <sburjan> I have to go, bbl a little bit later and continue  
16:02 <tmortagne> sburjan: because you probably started on node2  
16:02 <tmortagne> now there is only one node  
16:02 <tmortagne> node1  
16:02 <sburjan> has quit  
16:26 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <Denis> has quit  
16:31 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
16:34 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:49 <sburjan`> tmortagne, vmassol: gonna start from scratch, but I will create a JIRA improvement because of the annoyance of clicking continue too many times  
17:02 <cjd> has quit  
17:02 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
17:09 <cjd> has quit  
17:09 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
17:24 <sdumitriu1> tmortagne: I accidentally pressed the Continue button at the bottom of the Distribution Wizard before upgrading  
17:25 <sdumitriu1> Now I can't access the DW anymore  
17:25 <tmortagne> you mean you pressed continue on the first step ?  
17:26 <tmortagne> on which wiki ?  
17:26 <sdumitriu1> Not the first  
17:26 <sdumitriu1> sergiu.myxwiki.org  
17:26 <sdumitriu1> The second step where it lists what will be upgraded or installed  
17:27 <sdumitriu1> With all the dependencies of the XE UI  
17:27 <tmortagne> ha ok, it's weird that button was enabled if the UI was invalid  
17:28 <tmortagne> I can reinit the status of this wiki and restart myxwiki.org so that you get DW  
17:29 <sdumitriu1> I'm trying from the Extension Manager  
17:30 <tmortagne> yes you can do that too  
17:30 <tmortagne> it's pretty much the same thing  
17:37 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
17:58 <sdumitriu1> tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/attachment/25962/upgrading-activity.png  
18:00 <tmortagne> sdumitriu1: if you have any idea how to reproduce this, would be nice to create a jira issue about it  
18:00 <sdumitriu1> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9122  
18:02 <tmortagne> thanks  
18:04 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
18:28 <kstuart1> has joined #xwiki  
18:29 <kstuart> has quit  
18:34 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:57 <cjd\_> has quit  
19:10 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
19:16 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:21 <tdelafosse> has quit  
19:39 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:54 <altker128> has joined #xwiki  
20:55 <altker128> Hi all.  Is anyone here using XWiki 5.01 w/Postgres 9.x?  I'm following the guide here(http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/BSD\_Install) and there's an instruction to edit the WEB-INF/hibernate.cfg.xml and I'm still wondering if that's needed.  
20:55 <altker128> The guide here does NOT mention this: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationPostgreSQL  
21:00 <sdumitriu1> altker128: Yes, it's needed  
21:01 <altker128> sdumitriu1: Got it, thanks.  I re-read both pages and I see that the FBSD guide is more detailed but the file needs to be modified anyhow  
21:02 <altker128> sdumitriu1: The default config is hsqldb , is there any issue using that?  
21:02 <sdumitriu1> If you want to use Postgres, then you can't use HSQLDB  
21:02 <sdumitriu1> HSQLDB is decent, it's actually pretty fast  
21:02 <sdumitriu1> Much faster than all the other  
21:02 <sdumitriu1> s  
21:03 <sdumitriu1> But the default configuration is to store everything in memory  
21:03 <sdumitriu1> So it won't scale well if you plan to put a lot of content in the wiki  
21:03 <altker128> sdumitriu1: The default config of HSQLDB?  I'm not beholden to Postgres, but I am setting this up on FBSD  
21:04 <sdumitriu1> You can stick with HSQLDB  
21:04 <sdumitriu1> But then there are a few questions you have to ask yourself:  
21:05 <sdumitriu1> - How big is your data going to be?  
21:05 <sdumitriu1> - How much redundancy do you want to have? There are dedicated tools and lots of guides for setting up backups for mysql and postgresql, but not so much for HSQLDB  
21:06 <sdumitriu1> I'm not saying it's not possible to use HSQLDB for a large or safe database, just that it's harder to find guides for setting that up  
21:08 <altker128> Gotcha.  This is for personal use, I don't think the datasets will be huge but I've already done 90% of the setup for PSQL...so might as well just use it  
23:01 <vmassol> has quit
